law.catch_line: Department may carry insurance on bridges.

text.section: The department may carry a reasonable amount of insurance to cover any accident or destruction to any bridge until it has been fully paid for and used only as a free bridge.
The department may carry a reasonable amount of casualty insurance on any bridge while under construction, which bridge is being built by the commission and not by contract.

law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4356s-12.
